action.action-desc: Mr. Jones introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to ensure that every military chaplain has the prerogative to close a prayer outside of a religious service according to the dictates of the chaplain’s own conscience.

section.header: Protection of the religious freedom of military chaplains to close a prayer outside of a religious service according to the dictates of the chaplain’s conscience

subsection.text: Section 3547 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
If called upon to lead a prayer outside of a religious service, a chaplain shall have the prerogative to close the prayer according to the dictates of the chaplain’s own conscience.
Section 4337 of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: If called upon to lead a prayer outside of a religious service, the Chaplain shall have the prerogative to close the prayer according to the dictates of the Chaplain’s conscience.
